intro: Oldenlandia nematocaulis var. pedicellata, commonly known as the hairy false nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. The leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and covered with fine hairs, giving the plant a fuzzy appearance. Small white to pale yellow flowers are borne in clusters, and the plant produces small, bead-like berries that are typically red when mature. It is often found in disturbed soils and is native to parts of Africa and Asia.
